featured.text: While the Iron Curtain was still in place under the communist government, Prague was ＿29＿ visited by foreigners.
Franklin ran an iron rod through a hole in the top of each hemisphere so that they could nest together from largest to smallest.
The new structure will be 200 meters high, 100 meters shorter than the cast-iron Eiffel Tower built 100 years ago.
Deer are attracted to railway lines because of a need for iron in their diets.
They lick the rails to pick up iron filings caused by the action of wheels against tracks.

other.text: The heavy weight of iron materials.
His 1848 novel, The Man in the Iron Mask, was recently made into a movie.
An iron rod is used to strike the thicker glass hemispheres.
The old iron Eiffel Tower needs to be re-built with wood.
To form a contrast with the iron structure of the old tower.
What does the highlighted “they” in the second paragraph refer to? (A) Iron rods.

definition.zh_def: 一種金屬元素，符號為Fe，具有良好的導電性和延展性，常用於製造鋼鐵和其他合金。
definition.en_def: A metallic element, symbol Fe, known for its good conductivity and malleability, commonly used in the production of steel and other alloys.
definition.example: The bridge is made of iron to ensure its strength and durability.
